definition: Customer Communication Management. A strategy and software category for creating, delivering, and managing outbound customer communications.
Decoupling the content creation and logic layer of CCM from the delivery channel, allowing communications to be served via API to any frontend.
An enterprise-grade CCM platform used by banks and insurers to generate high-volume, personalized documents.
SmartCommunications. A cloud-native CCM platform known for its interactive drafting and Salesforce integration capabilities.
Enterprise Content Management. The methodology for managing the lifecycle of an organization's documents and unstructured content.
A document (like a policy or contract) that allows a human agent to modify specific data fields or clauses within pre-defined compliance guardrails.
